newsitem.title: UK: IPE GAS OIL CLOSES AT $169.50, BRENT DOWN 25 CTS.
newsitem.headline: IPE GAS OIL CLOSES AT $169.50, BRENT DOWN 25 CTS.

text.p: IPE gas oil futures closed down $3 and towards the lows on Friday on good technical selling and weaker underlying physical crude and products, brokers said.
Front month August gas oil settled at $169.50 a tonne, a dollar off the low, after touching a high of $171.00. September settled at $171.00, also down $3.
Chartists put support for August at $169.00 with initial resistance at $171, followed by a gap to $172.
September Brent was trading down 25 cents at $18.65 a barrel on news that Iraq was given the green light by the United Nations to sell oil for the first time since the end of May.
The crude is expected to start flowing next week.
The Brent front month had dipped to a fresh intra-day low of $18.56 after word that the U.N. Sanctions Committee had raised no objections to price formulas for the Iraqi exports.
The underlying Brent cargo market was also weak despite good refining margins on both sides of the Atlantic.
Dated Brent was offered at around September -20 cents, the level Brent was traded on Thursday and some 38 cents lower than the previous reported deal. Offers were around -30 cents.
Oil products were also weak in Europe. A sharp drop in gasoline helped undermine Brent and gas oil barges were narrowly easier, although cargo differentials held firm.
Dealers said there was good demand for diesel into France but German demand was muted with many traders away from the office on holiday.
